results.title: Energy: a national issue
results.creator_credit: Gerard H. Baldwin, Ross M Sutherland, Hanna-Barbera Productions and Instructional Media
results.brief_description: Animated film featuring the Flintstones with narration by Charlton Heston to explain the problems of a dwindling energy supply and the means by which to obtain more efficient energy use. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: The Kelly gang
results.brief_description: Restored by the National Film and Sound Archive, this film represents a substantial proportion of the original footage produced by Harry Southwell in 1920. Starring Godfrey Cass as Ned Kelly, the film includes both outdoor scenes and badly dressed roofless studio interiors that reflect Southwell’s inexperience as a producer.

results.title: Like two mountaineers: the development of Cubism
results.creator_credit: Ross Campbell and Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre
results.brief_description: Using examples from the Modern Masters exhibition, this film traces the early influences of Suerat, Cezanne and African art on the development of Cubism. Paintings of Picasso and Braque are shown in great detail from the period when they worked “like two mounaineers roped together”. No commentary, music soundtrack only. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Sleep
results.brief_description: Talks about what sleep is; why we need it; what happens to the body during sleep. It makes parallels between human and animal sleep. Suitable for middle primary level.

results.title: Solar power
results.creator_credit: Leo A. Handel, Peter Mertens and Handel Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Discusses a large number of examples of solar power. Presents three specific areas of energy generation and preservation: passive solar heating, active thermal heating and photovoltaic production of electricity.

results.title: Sigaalow: Town of dust
results.creator_credit: Leslie Jenkins, Office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees and United Nations
results.brief_description: Examines the problems relating to living conditions faced by Somalian refugees from the Ogaden. Shows the efforts being made by the Somali government to deal with these problems and the need for International Aid.

results.title: Hallelujah Darwin!
results.creator_credit: Kip Cates, Robert Brandreth-Gibbs and Magic Lantern
results.brief_description: The biography of Charles Darwin is told using animated characters. His educational and religious background is followed by his voyage with reasons for the development of his theory of natural selection.

results.creator_credit: David Corke and Crafts Council of Australia

results.title: At the foot of Mt Fuji
results.brief_description: A day in the life of a ten year old child who lives in a small town at the base of Mt Fuji in Japan, is revealed in his letter to a pen pal in the United States. Suitable for Early-Middle Primary students. No other credits available.
